result.execSummary:
The defendant Tonee L Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: **CONCURRENT to any sentence.   Straight time. Court recommends against electronic monitoring. 
Court does not suspend driving privileges.
*3/18/2016 Honorable Ellen R. Brostrom-amended to state concurrent to any sentence.
**4/11/2016  Honorable Ellen R. Brostrom.  Order signed.  Credit amended to 242 days.

charges.descr: Sex with Child Age 16 or Older

supervisions.notes: EACH COUNT:  Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Concurrent with: CONCURRENT.
If deemed appropriate Court orders the defendant to serve sentence at the Racine Juvenile Correction facility.
*4/11/2016  Honorable Ellen R. Brostrom.  Order signed.  Credit amended to 242 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain GED/HSED.
Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.

No unsupervised contact with children 16 years of age and under.
Can never have employment/volunteer where he will supervise or work with children.

Sex offender assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
Cognitive intervention programming.
Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

superTimeConds.notes: Court order 25 hours, yearly, of community service at a non-profit organization.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tonee L Smith

(orig. in 14cf4943)

Defendant Tonee L Smith in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Tonee L Smith in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.

State has complied with victim notification.  Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statements by: Alice H., Victoria S. and Pastor Eugene Y.
COUNT 2 - CONDURRENT:
Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 247 days served; Straight time. Court recommends against electronic monitoring. 
Court does not suspend driving privileges.

COUNT 3 - CONCURRENT:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS, with credit for 247 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  If deemed approciate Court orders the defendant to serve sentence at the Racine Juvenile Correction facility.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Sex offender assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* No unsupervised contact with children 16 years of age and under.
* Can never have employment/volunteer where he will supervise or work with children.
* Court order 25 hours, yearly, of community service at a non-profit organization.
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.

Defendant Tonee L Smith in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Tonee L Smith in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defense request an adjournment for late receipt of the PSI.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tonee L Smith in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Tonee L Smith in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.

AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 6.    At request of the parties, Court ordered PSI report.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.  Court vacates the 8/19/2015 jury trial date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Parties would like this case to tag along with defendant's pending case 14CF4943.  Court does not object.
